content.question: The function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="f of x equals, 1 plus, 3 times the cosine of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the average rate of change of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> over the interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma pi, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>π</mi><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
